IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC (THE "FOUNDATION") IS DEDICATED TO GROWING PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO ENSURING THE DETROIT REGION'S ECONOMY IS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING IN THE U.S.
IRS990.MissionDesc: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. (THE "FOUNDATION") IS DEDICATED TO GROWING PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO ENSURING THE DETROIT REGION'S ECONOMY IS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING IN THE U.S.
IRS990.Desc: FORWARD DETROIT IS THE FOUNDATION'S REGIONALLY FOCUSED STRATEGY TO DRIVE ECONOMIC GROWTH AND HELP SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN ACHIEVE LONG-TERM PROSPERITY IN THE GLOBAL MARKET.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE FOUNDATION'S TALENT AND EDUCATION INITIATIVES ARE FOCUSED ON INCREASING ADULTS WITH POST-SECONDARY DEGREES IN THE REGION. THE FOUNDATION COLLABORATES WITH REGIONAL PHILANTHROPIC, EDUCATION, GOVERNMENT, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS ON THESE EFFORTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: LEADERSHIP DETROIT SERVES OVER 65 INDIVIDUALS ANNUALLY VIA 12 FULL DAY SESSIONS TO GROW THEIR REGIONAL KNOWLEDGE AND DEVELOP THEM AS FUTURE LEADERS IN THE REGION. SESSION TOPICS INCLUDE REGIONAL COLLABORATION, RACE, HEALTH AND EDUCATION.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC AND THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER (THE "CHAMBER") HAVE COMMON MANAGEMENT TEAMS. MANAGEMENT HAS A COPY OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE DETERMINATION LETTER INDICATING THAT THE CHAMBER QUALIFIES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(6). MANAGEMENT ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE CHAMBER'S FINANCIAL ACTIVITY TO ASCERTAIN THAT THE CHAMBER CONTINUES TO SATISFY THE PUBLIC SUPPORT TESTS UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 509(A)(2).

ANY FUNDS PROVIDED BY THE FOUNDATION TO THE CHAMBER ARE USED BY THE PROGRAMS FOR WHICH THEY ARE INTENDED. ALL PROGRAMS OF BOTH THE FOUNDATION AND THE CHAMBER HAVE THEIR OWN COST CENTERS TO KEEP FINANCIAL ACTIVITY SEGREGATED. THIS ACTIVITY IS MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATIONS' COMMON MANAGEMENT TEAMS.

THE MEMBERSHIP OF THE FOUNDATION CONSISTS OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CHAMBER'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE CHAMBER'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVES THE SELECTION OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS POLICIES THAT ARE SUBMITTED TO THE CHAMBER'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR APPROVAL. THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS DOES NOT VOTE ON OR INSTITUTE ANY POLICY INDEPENDENT OF THE CHAMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S MANAGEMENT IS NOT AWARE OF ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AS OF JUNE 30, 2017 OR 2018.

THE FOUNDATION ACCRUES BONUS COMPENSATION FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND OTHER EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT STAFF BASED ON PREDETERMINED PERCENTAGES THAT HAVE BEEN OUTLINED IN THEIR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS OR OTHER EMPLOYMENT MEMOS AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE FINAL BONUS ELIGIBILITY AND AMOUNT IS BASED ON PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS AND PERCENTAGES OF GOAL ACHIEVEMENT APPROVED BY THE CEO AND THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. PAYOUT OF ANY PERFORMANCE BONUS IS SUBJECT TO OVERALL CONSOLIDATED ORGANIZATIONAL FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE TO ENSURE SUFFICIENT FUNDS AND IS NOT PAID UNTIL THE FINANCIAL RESULTS OF THE FOUNDATION'S SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER, ARE DETERMINED AT THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. THE BONUSES ARE PAID OUT WITHIN 75 DAYS OF THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, THE CEO BONUS WAS APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CHAIR TO BE PAID OUT IN JULY 2018. IF THE BOARD APPROVED BUDGETED NET PERFORMANCE RESULTS OF THE CONSOLIDATED CHAMBER WERE NOT MET, THE BONUS AMOUNTS WOULD BE REDUCED OR ELIMINATED SO AS NOT TO CREATE NEGATIVE NET EARNINGS AS COMPARED TO THE BUDGET FOR THE FOUNDATION. BONUS POOLS FOR THE CEO, EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT TEAM, AND OTHER EMPLOYEES ARE APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. CONSISTS OF 16 PROMINENT BUSINESS LEADERS FROM THE COMMUNITY. REPRESENTING A DIVERSITY OF BUSINESS SECTORS. THERE ARE BOARD MEMBERS WHOSE COMPANIES HAVE "ARMS LENGTH" BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS WITH OTHER BOARD MEMBERS' COMPANIES. THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD MEMBERS ARE ALSO IN HIGH DEMAND TO SERVE ON OTHER BOARDS. IT IS NOT UNUSUAL FOR SOME OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD MEMBERS TO SIT ON OTHER BOARDS, INCLUDING COMPANIES THAT ARE REPRESENTED ON THE FOUNDATION BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION ARE THOSE PERSONS THAT CONSTITUTE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM AND IS REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS APPOINTED AN AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE, WHICH IS A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE'S PRIMARY FUNCTION IS TO ASSIST THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN FULFILLING ITS OVERSIGHT RESPONSIBILITIES BY REVIEWING THE FINANCIAL INFORMATION WHICH WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE FOUNDATION AND OTHERS, THE SYSTEM OF INTERNAL CONTROLS WHICH MANAGEMENT AND THE BOARD HAVE ESTABLISHED, AND THE AUDIT PROCESS. IN DOING SO, IT IS THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE'S RESPONSIBILITY TO PROVIDE AN OPEN AVENUE OF COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, MANAGEMENT, AND THE FOUNDATION'S EXTERNAL AUDITORS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF THE FORM 990, THE RETURN IS REVIEWED WITH THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. SHARES ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF WITH ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER. THE CHAMBER AND ITS COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HAVE AN EXTENSIVE PROCESS TO REVIEW ALL MATTERS OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
FEES FOR SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 1,547,515. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 1,547,515.

PRIMARY ACTIVITY - THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER IS A CHAMBER OF COMMERCE AND IS THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION OF THE FOUNDATION. MICHIGAN FUTURE, INC'S MISSION IS TO DEVELOP AND ADVANCE A PRACTICAL VISION OF MICHIGAN'S SOCIAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND ECONOMIC FUTURE.

RELATIONSHIP TO ORGANIZATION - DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER SERVICES, INC. IS A WHOLLY-OWNED SUBSIDIARY OF THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER. NATIONAL COMMERCE GROUP, WHICH IS A WHOLLY-OWNED SUBSIDIARY OF DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER SERVICES, INC.

SHARED COSTS - THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER (THE "CHAMBER") AND DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. (THE "FOUNDATION") SHARE A COMMON OFFICE AND UTILIZE A COMMON PAYROLL SYSTEM, WITH ALL PAYROLL TAX RETURNS FILED BY THE CHAMBER. DIRECT EXPENSES FOR THE FOUNDATION ARE CHARGED DIRECTLY. SHARED FACILITY COSTS, AS WELL AS ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF, ARE ALLOCATED BETWEEN THE ORGANIZATIONS BASED ON FTE. THESE COSTS, AND THE METHOD IN WHICH THEY ARE ALLOCATED ARE DEFINED IN A FORMAL COST SHARING AGREEMENT. THIS COST SHARING AGREEMENT HAS BEEN REVIEWED BY THE TAX DEPARTMENT OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM TO ENSURE THE AGREEMENT AND ALLOCATION METHOD ARE REASONABLE, ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, AND ARE APPLIED IN A CONSISTENT MANNER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE R, PART V, ITEM 2, COLUMN D
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: METHOD OF DETERMINING AMOUNT INVOLVED - BOARD AUTHORIZED CHARITABLE CONTRIBUTIONS.
